name: Althea Shrub
climate: The Althea Shrub thrives well in temperate climates with moderate rainfall.
It can also adapt to subtropical climates, provided it has good soil drainage.
This plant can tolerate dry conditions but will not do well in extreme cold.
In humid regions, ensure the plant is not exposed to waterlogged conditions.
sunlight: The Althea Shrub prefers full sun to partial shade for optimal growth.
It should receive at least six to eight hours of sunlight per day.
In regions with intense sunlight, slight afternoon shade is beneficial.
Lack of sufficient sunlight can result in fewer blooms and weak branches.
watering: Water the Althea Shrub regularly during the growing season for healthy blooms.
Ensure the plant is watered deeply, allowing the soil to dry a bit between watering.
During dry periods, increase watering frequency to maintain soil moisture.
Do not overwater, as it can lead to root rot, especially in clay soils.
soil: Althea Shrubs prefer well-draining soil that is rich in organic matter.
They can grow in a variety of soil types, including sandy or loamy soil.
Avoid heavy clay soils which can retain excessive moisture, leading to root issues.
A slightly acidic to neutral pH is ideal, but they can tolerate some alkalinity.
extra_care_tip: Prune the Althea Shrub in late winter or early spring to promote bushier growth.
Mulch around the base to conserve moisture and suppress weeds effectively.
Fertilize lightly during the growing season to enhance flowering and foliage.
Watch for pests such as aphids and treat promptly to prevent infestations.
